6. Oasis Science Package¶

6.1. science.laser_control module¶

class science.laser_control.Laser¶
_Laser__kicker()¶

Queries for status every second in order to kick the laser’s WDT on shots >= 2s

_Laser__send_command(cmd)¶

Sends command to laser

Parameters

cmd (bytes) – This contains the byte signature of the command to be sent

__init__()¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

arm()¶

Sends command to laser to arm

check_armed()¶

Checks if the laser is armed

connect(port_number, baud_rate=115200, timeout=5, parity=None)¶

Sets up connection between flight computer and laser

Parameters

  • port_number (int) – This is the port number for the laser

  • baud_rate (int) – Bits per second on serial connection

  • timeout (int) – A buffer for if connection is not established

disarm()¶

Sends command to laser to disarm

fire_laser()¶

Sends commands to laser to have it fire

get_status()¶

Obtains the status of the laser

update_settings()¶

Updates laser settings

science.laser_control.list_available_ports()¶

6.2. science.testing_utils module¶

class science.testing_utils.dummy_laser¶
receive_command(cmd)¶
science.testing_utils.generate_dummy_spectra(central_spectra=500, 730, 380, width=100, bins=10000.0, optical_range=300, 1064)¶

Generates dummy spectra for debugging purposes. Outputs tuple of arrays, index 0 holds the wavelength and index 1 holds the intensity value. Useful when no spectrometers is present.

Parameters

  • central_spectra (list) – Integer list of wavelengths to center on

  • width (int) – Width of individual line

  • bins (int) – Number of samples

  • optical_range (tuple) – Range of values to be generated

Returns

Ruple of arrays. index 0 holds wavelengths, index 1 holds intensity data

Return type

tuple
